001package squidpony.examples.squidpony.examples.snowman;
002
003import squidpony.squidgrid.gui.SColor;
004
005/**
006 * This class represents a single map space.
007 *
008 * All spaces are initialy marked as not seen by the player.
009 *
010 * @author Eben Howard
011 */
012public class Tile {
013
014    private static final char WALL_SYMBOL = 'â–’', FLOOR_SYMBOL = '.', UNKNOWN_SYMBOL = ' ';
015    private Monster monster;
016    private Treasure treasure;
017    private boolean seen = false;
018    private boolean wall = false;
019
020    /**
021     * Creates a tile with no monster or wall.
022     */
023    public Tile() {
024    }
025
026    /**
027     * Creates a tile that is a wall.
028     *
029     * @param wall
030     */
031    public Tile(boolean wall) {
032        this.wall = wall;
033    }
034
035    /**
036     * Creates a tile with the provided monster and no wall.
037     *
038     * @param monster
039     */
040    public Tile(Monster monster) {
041        this.monster = monster;
042    }
043
044    public Treasure getTreasure() {
045        return treasure;
046    }
047
048    public void setTreasure(Treasure treasure) {
049        this.treasure = treasure;
050    }
051
052    public Monster getMonster() {
053        return monster;
054    }
055
056    public void setMonster(Monster monster) {
057        this.monster = monster;
058    }
059
060    public boolean isSeen() {
061        return seen;
062    }
063
064    public void setSeen(boolean seen) {
065        this.seen = seen;
066    }
067
068    public boolean isWall() {
069        return wall;
070    }
071
072    /**
073     * Returns the symbol that should be used for this tile.
074     *
075     * @return
076     */
077    public char getSymbol() {
078        if (!seen) {
079            return UNKNOWN_SYMBOL;
080        }
081
082        if (monster != null) {
083            return monster.getSymbol();
084        }
085
086        if (treasure != null) {
087            return '$';
088        }
089
090        if (wall) {
091            return WALL_SYMBOL;
092        }
093
094        return FLOOR_SYMBOL;
095    }
096
097    /**
098     * Returns the color that should be used for this tile.
099     *
100     * @return
101     */
102    public SColor getColor() {
103        if (!seen) {
104            return SColor.BLACK;
105        }
106
107        if (monster != null) {
108            return monster.getColor();
109        }
110
111        if (treasure != null) {
112            return SColor.GOLDEN;
113        }
114
115        if (wall) {
116            return SColor.GREYISH_DARK_GREEN;
117        }
118
119        return SColor.DARK_SLATE_GRAY;
120    }
121}
